channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: ‘Pure Chaos’: Warnings of an Alberta Health-Care Crisis
item.description: Experts say AHS data obtained by The Tyee further indicates the system faces being overwhelmed.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: The assassination target ‘betrayed' by Carney's India policy
item.description: Warned by RCMP three times he was to be killed, Moninder Singh said Sikhs feel let down by Canada's decision to resume ties with India.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Housing crisis, cost of living fuelling Nunavut voter apathy
item.description: Ahead of Nunavut’s 7th territorial election, there is concern about a decline in voter turnout, something experts say is likely caused by slow progress to tackle issues such as the housing crisis and cost of living.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canada's men beat U.S. for Pan Continental curling gold medal
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: After daughter attacked by dogs, Alberta mother calls on First Nation for regulations
item.description: The Alberta mother of a five-year-old who was attacked by dogs and says she wants First Nations communities to put regulations in place to prevent similar incidents from happening.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Some Canadian communities make it mandatory for homeowners to replace lead pipes. Do such bylaws work?
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Tim Cook, chief historian at Canadian War Museum, dies at 54
item.description: Tim Cook, the chief historian at the Canadian War Museum and the country’s “pre-eminent military historian,” has died, the museum announced Sunday.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: The Georgia Straight's guide to the 2025 Vancouver International Film Festival

item.title: ‘Between Breaths’ Comes to the Firehall
item.description: The critically acclaimed play about Newfoundland’s ‘Whale Man’ sails into Vancouver.

item.title: $32M case against Ontario developer falls apart at regulator hearing
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: What’s in a name? Sask. town looking to find out by selling naming rights to highest bidder
item.description: The small Saskatchewan town of Duck Lake could soon bear a new name, after its council voted to move forward with putting the town's permanent naming rights up for sale. Mayor Jason Anderson says he's hoping corporations or anyone willing to pay a minimum of $10 million will see the value of putting their mark on the map.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Mayor in northern Ontario says bank putting shareholders ahead of consumers as town’s last branch set to close
item.description: Banks are closing branches in smaller communities across northwestern Ontario, leaving residents concerned about a lack of options to get cash or change.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator
